intro: Traganthes compositifolia, commonly known as the composite-leaf traganthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence, often resembling a composite flower head. Its leaves are typically lobed or divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Traganthes compositifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
